intro: Psychotria subsessiliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
